author: A L B

text: When i finally got the chance to play Earthbound, I was so ecstatic to play it.  After playing it, It confirmed why Earthbound is my favorite soundtrack of all time.  There are so many great themes in this game that have been ingrained in my head.  This theme is definitely one of them.
author: Eric C.

text: Watching AVGN's latest big episode on Earthbound was a treat, it's always nice to hear about people playing one of your favorite games of all time, and he actually brought some very nice points I hadn't really thought about. Truly a masterpiece in my eyes, with what I still consider the best game soundtrack ever made. It evokes childhood memories and nostalgia like few other games can. This Hospital theme and its awesome bass sticks to you, which is why I even made a remix of it.
author: SupraDarky

text: SupraDarky I need to check out you mix of this. Love those demping trumps.
author: Philip J. Fry II

text: Same here! I watched his new EarthBound episode as soon as I saw that he posted it. This is a game I've been in love with for years, and while my favorite games have all come and go, this is still one I am very fond of. And seeing AVGN's take on some things gave me some new perspective on the game, and I was admittedly close to tears when he brought up Young Ness's lines in Magicant. That was one thing I didn't really notice as a kid, but I think this is one of those games where you'd have to go back to it at an older age to really appreciate things like that.
author: That Gaming Author

text:
His video was fantastic! I love me some in depth videos on Earthbound. It has so many stories to be told, and every person's story of the game is slightly different. It leaves a lot of thinking to the player throughout the game. 

I feel like his grudges with Earthbound could be summarized with: some aspects could be sped up. Personally, I don't mind these flaws so much. I can't say that I played Earthbound for the combat, but rather the overall experience and the world created by Shigesato Itoi.
author: Eirian Odalis
